lead_paragraph: SPANISH BAR, Aug. 8.--On the 4th inst., while Mr. S. Jackson, of the State of New-York and W. J. Bruce, an Irishman, were traveling from Junction Bar to Grey Eagle City, they fell in with a company of Indians, between the North and Middle Forks, on the Ridge Trail, about seven miles distant from here, who, at first, appeared kindly disposed, in return for which my friends distributed among them a few pounds of crackers.
